intro: Correa reflexa var. lobata, commonly known as the broad-leafed correa, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers. The plant features broad, ovate to lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a distinctive, glossy appearance. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and is well adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. The flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract nectar-feeding birds and insects.
